page.title: 18TEALING AIRFIELD
page.content: No.56 Operational Training Unit was moved from Sutton Bridge to Tealing in March 1942. Hurricanes, Masters and some Lysanders were used for pilot training. Later in the war the unit was reorganised into the chain of Tactical Exercise Units and often played host to larger aircraft such as Dakotas. The Hurricanes (veterans of the Battle of Britain) were replaced by Spitfires. In May 1942 a Russian TB-7 bomber landed at Tealing carrying the Russian Foreign Minister Molotov on a top secret mission. The site is not ideal for an airfield being a frost and fog hollow and during the war the hills to the NW made night flying impossible. This may in part explain why it was not chosen as the site for Dundee Airport. The airfield was closed in 1945 and electricity power cables cross the area now.
